data.actual_result: The old name gets used on the more recent posts that uses the newer name all the time.
data.expected_result: Like with users, the latest name/metadata would be shown in the pop-out of the recent posts.
data.short_description: The name of a webhook in the pop-out modal reverts to an old name if that name is loaded in client
data.steps_to_repro: - Create a webhook with a set name (eg: Webhook A). - Make the webhook post a few times in the channel. - Change the name of the webhook to something else (eg Webhook B). - Make sure the old posts are pushed out of sight (so they're not loaded within the first 50). - Make the webhook post with the new name. - Change to another server, then reload the client so your cache is empty. - Click profile for your webhook's new name and observe name. - Scroll up chat history so the old name and new name of the same webhook are loaded in your client. - Click profile for your webhook's new name with the old ones loaded and observe.
